Here's what a JavaScript equivalent for PHPâ€™s array_chunk might look like

{% highlight javascript %}
function strcspn (str, mask, start, length) {
  //  discuss at: http://phpjs.org/functions/strcspn/
  // original by: Brett Zamir (http://brett-zamir.me)
  //   example 1: strcspn('abcdefg123', '1234567890');
  //   returns 1: 7
  //   example 2: strcspn('123abc', '1234567890');
  //   returns 2: 3

  start = start ? start : 0
  var count = (length && ((start + length) < str.length)) ? start + length : str.length
  strct: for (var i = start, lgth = 0; i < count; i++) {
    for (var j = 0; j < mask.length; j++) {
      if (str.charAt(i)
        .indexOf(mask[j]) !== -1) {
        continue strct
      }
    }++lgth
  }

  return lgth
}

{% endhighlight %}

## Example 1

{% highlight javascript %}
strcspn('abcdefg123', '1234567890');
{% endhighlight %}

Should return

{% highlight javascript %}
strcspn('abcdefg123', '1234567890');{% endhighlight %}

## Example 2

{% highlight javascript %}
strcspn('123abc', '1234567890');
{% endhighlight %}

Should return

{% highlight javascript %}
strcspn('123abc', '1234567890');{% endhighlight %}
